divs: sighting detailswhen i originally witnessed this phenomenon i didn't know about mufon (just discoved this site after a similar sighting happened on july 4th 2009) on january 17th around 10pm i was driving south on wyandotte trying to get my daughter to fall asleep when i noticed a cluster of orange glowing lights in the sky over westport. at first i thought they might be airplanes or helicopters but when i stopped and rolled down the window i heard no sound and upon further observation i saw they were too low to be airplanes. the main attraction was a cluster of approximately 5 or 6 orbs within relative close proximity of eachother, outlining an almost triangular pattern. they were all brightly illuminated and pulsing, almost like a fire contained within glass. there was no trail of any kind left behind. in the middle of the cluster i did notice one really faint white light moving steadily at the same speed as the others. when i turned west onto 39th street i noticed three more of these orbs spaced out across the sky almost to the edge of the horizon, also forming the outline of a triangle. all pulsing with the same red\orange fire-like luminosity. on july 4th, my boyfriend and i witnessed a solitary "fireball" move steadily southward, ironically enough during a conversation about my experience in january.
trends: There have been 134 other sightings in Kansas City
There were 2 other sightings in Kansas City on or around January 17th 2009
